title: (x) National Geographic logo - ITC Stone Sans (customised) {Yves}
content:
Hi :), Does anybody know what is the san serif used in the new national geographic Logo?  
(not the old one with times Condenced)?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150407040852im_/http:/typophile.com/files/National_Geographic_logo_5676.jpg)
author: Tal A

comments.content:
I can't place it, but Syntax and The Sans are similar.

Anyone else?

The R's in both those suggestions aren't quite the right form. The G, R and C are about the only diagnostic ones in these words.

I would pick [Formata Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20150407040852/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/formata-bq/cnd/charmap.html), although I wouldn't be surprised if it was custom designed for the NGS.

- Mike Yanega

[ITC Stone Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20150407040852/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=EF.1112.0.2&attributes.sampleSize=32&sampleText=NATIONAL+GEOGRAPHIC&sampleSize=24). Close the P, customise the R and [squoosh](http://web.archive.org/web/20150407040852/http:/typophile.com/wiki/squooshed) a little.

Just for the archives: [Takeshi-san](http://web.archive.org/web/20150407040852/http:/www.myfonts.com/WhatTheFont/forum/viewthread.php?threadid=53284) discovered the name as NatGeo Sans from a PDF-file.

Nice one. Thanks for the extra info, Rainer.

Now where _are_ those archives?... (goes wandering off in the building)

;^)
